alert.note: Alert for Butler; Montgomery; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 17 at 8:41PM EDT until July 17 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN BUTLER...NORTHWESTERN WARREN AND SOUTH CENTRAL MONTGOMERY COUNTIES... At 841 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Middletown, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Middletown, Mason, Miamisburg, Lebanon, Springboro, Monroe, Franklin, Carlisle, Hunter, Germantown, Centerville, State Route 63 at State Route 741, Lytle, Pekin, State Route 48 at State Route 73 and Poast Town Heights. This includes I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 30 and 42. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
